snippet: A year after the repeal of “don’t ask, don’t tell,” many gay students at military academies enjoy a visibility that was once unimaginable.
abstract: Many gay students at military academies, one year after repeal of 'don’t ask, don’t tell' policy, are enjoying a visibility on campus that was once unimaginable; some are starting and joining gay-themed clubs and events and have begun openly talking about their partners.
lead_paragraph: A year after the repeal of “don’t ask, don’t tell,” many gay students at military academies enjoy a visibility that was once unimaginable.

headline.seo: Military Academies Adjusting to Repeal of ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell’
headline.main: Out of the Closet and Into a Uniform
headline.print_headline: Out of the Closet and Still in Uniform
